page.title: 10Falkirk Tryst
page.content: One of the main{events}of the area for the past 200 years is the Falkirk Tryst which came to Stenhousemuir in 1785, and by 1850, this event was at its zenith, selling overÂ£1,100,000 of cows, sheep, horses and goats in three {fairs}or{markets}annually-in Sept., Oct.and Nov. Tryst means"meeting place" and Stenhousemuir,with its flat sandy well-drained fields, was a suitable place for such a large gathering. When the railways came through Larbert there were two stations built, one a{cattle}station. Animals transported by train were in better condition than those travelling along the drove roads. So the Tryst declined, leaving the fair element only.Some of the ground is now used for football,golf,cricket and dog-walking. The rest has been built on.
